results.title: Les Devoirs a la maison
results.creator_credit: Michael Style, Donald Carter and Associated Television
results.brief_description: From the series “French from France”, this French language training film teaches students pronunciation of a broad vocabulary in the familiar setting of doing homework. The family all assist Monique in turn, and then her friends call and they all work together on mathematical problems and the theme of an essay. Their discussion of their work repeating key nouns assists in the learning of the vocabulary.

results.title: Les Cousins de 'la Constance': Episode 6
results.creator_credit: Robert Mazoyer and Marcel Degliame Fouche
results.brief_description:
In the village, the women wait nervously to hear reports about the fate of ‘La Constance’. While on its way back, the boat encounters a strong gale which causes the mine to start rolling about the deck.

results.title: Les Cousins de 'la Constance': Episode 5
results.creator_credit: Robert Mazoyer and Marcel Degliame Fouche
results.brief_description:
The first campaign of ‘La Constance’ has been marred by poor returns and lots of material damage. Jean is also increasingly worried that Anne is getting cold feet about becoming a fisherman’s wife. For the second campaign, Doctor Rey embarks on ‘La Constance’. Bad luck strikes again as the trawler picks up a WWII sea mine. While the crew disembarks on a life raft, the three Guillous stay on board to secure the mine.

Credits: Producer, Marcel Degliame Fouche ; director, Robert Mazoyer ; writer, Paul Guimard ; photography, Jean-Jacques Guyard ; music, Georges Delerue.
Cast: Jean Le Mouel, Claude Brosset, Lucien Barjon, Andree Tainsy, Jean-Marc Epinoux, Dominique Mac Avoy, Elina Labourdette, Jean-Pierre Kerien, Catherine Seynes.

results.title: Les Cousins de 'la Constance': Episode 4
results.creator_credit: Robert Mazoyer and Marcel Degliame Fouche
results.brief_description:
Anne spends time with Antoine during the two weeks Jean is away at sea. The first campaign proves very difficult for ‘La Constance’ as the fishing net is partially destroyed by a shipwreck. Marie-Josee has to cope on her own with a medical emergency involving Yvon, her son.

results.title: Les Cousins de 'la Constance': Episode 3
results.creator_credit: Robert Mazoyer and Marcel Degliame Fouche
results.brief_description:
The Guillou men spend summer fixing up ‘La Constance’. Romance is blossoming between Jean and Anne, Marie-Josee’s sister. Anne is both attracted to Jean and worried by the endless life of worrying and waiting that is already the lot of her sister. She seems equally attracted by the easy going lifestyle enjoyed by Arlette and Antoine, the children of Dr Rey, Marie-Josee’s tenants. After a quick round of recruiting, the crew of ‘La Constance’ is ready to set forth for a first fishing campaign.

Credits: Producer, Marcel Degliame Fouche ; director, Robert Mazoyer ; writer, Paul Guimard ; photography, Jean-Jacques Guyard ; music, Georges Delerue.
Cast: Jean Le Mouel, Claude Brosset, Lucien Barjon, Andree Tainsy, Jean-Marc Epinoux, Dominique Mac Avoy, Elina Labourdette, Jean-Pierre Kerien, Catherine Seynes.

results.title: Les Cousins de 'la Constance': Episode 2
results.creator_credit: Robert Mazoyer and Marcel Degliame Fouche
results.brief_description:
In order to gather finances to buy ‘La Constance’, the Guillous have to sell shares in their fishing business to local villagers. They are still working hard at convincing Mother Guillou to sell her treasured land to make up for the short fall. Meanwhile, Yves and Marie-Josee are moving their abode to the basement. The Summer season has arrived and the whole house is rented out to the family of a Parisian doctor.

Cast: Jean Le Mouel, Claude Brosset, Lucien Barjon, Andree Tainsy, Jean-Marc Epinoux, Dominique Mac Avoy, Elina Labourdette, Jean-Pierre Kerien, Catherine Seynes.

results.title: Les Cousins de 'la Constance': Episode 1
results.creator_credit: Robert Mazoyer and Marcel Degliame Fouche
results.brief_description:
Jean, the eldest son of the Guillous is returning to his village in Brittany after 8 months spent on a fishing boat, off the coast of Senegal. He has big plans to buy his own boat and employ his father, a retired fisherman, and his cousin Yves, a mechanic. Yves, a married man with two children, is keen on becoming a share-holder in a fishing enterprise. So is old man Guillou. The men have their heart set on buying ‘La Constance’. But, the financing of the project depends partially on Mother Guillou and the sale of a piece of land that was given to her as a dowry. For the women of the Guillou clan, the mother, Marie-Josee, Yves’ wife and Anne, Marie-Josee’s sister, the great adventure of ‘La Constance’ means more worrying and waiting by the radio, listening for weather and ship movements reports. It also means balancing tight budgets by opening the house to summer invaders: Parisian tourists. Les cousins de ‘La Constance’ is a faithful portraiture of the ‘real’ Brittany, its landscapes, its inhabitants, its ‘patois’ as well as a good introduction to the rites and rituals of the world of fishermen.

Credits: Producer, Marcel Degliame Fouche ; director, Robert Mazoyer ; writer, Paul Guimard ; photography, Jean-Jacques Guyard ; music, Georges Delerue.
Cast: Jean Le Mouel, Claude Brosset, Lucien Barjon, Andree Tainsy, Jean-Marc Epinoux, Dominique Mac Avoy, Elina Labourdette, Jean-Pierre Kerien, Catherine Seynes.

results.title: Les Coeurs Verts = the Green Hearts
results.brief_description:
Two young men, fresh out of prison for misdemeanor, attempt to stay on the straight and narrow. They often find themselves torn between family, mates and the necessity of finding a job. Filmed in the high-rise projects of Nanterre, this film is an uncompromising look at the life of young people eking a living at the edge of society. By its choice of topic and its stylistic, this film is at odds with the mainstream of the 1960s cinematographic production. Other artists and technicians credited: Maurice Dugowson, Serge Gainsbourg. See also: Les enfants du Palais [X000369] and Le petit Marcel [X000486].

Credits: Producer, Raoul Ploquin ; director, writer, Edouard Luntz ; photography, Jean Badal ; music, Jean-Louis Chautemps, Bernard Vitet, Guy Pedersen, Daniel Humair, Henri Renaud ; editors, Colette Kouchner, Suzanne Schiffman.
Cast: Gerard Zimmermann, Erick Penet, Maryse Maire, Paul Preboist, Francois Dyrek.

results.title: Les Chouans = the Royalists
results.brief_description:
Marquis de Montauran has been chosen to lead ‘les Chouans’ (the army formed by the inhabitants of the western provinces of France opposed to the Revolutionary government). But he falls in love with a spy working for the republican government, the very beautiful Marie de Verneuil.

Credits: Producer, Georges Legrand ; director, Henri Calef ; writer, Charles Spaak, Pierre Brive ; photography, Claude Renoir ; music, Joseph Kosma.
Cast: Jean Marais, Madeleine Robinson, Madeleine Lebeau, Marcel Herrand, Pierre Dux, Louis Seigner, Jacques Charron, Armontel.

results.title: Les Aventures de Salavin = the Adventures of Salavin
results.brief_description:
The Salavin cycle describes the frustrations and perplexities of a ‘little man’ of the 20th century trying to work out his own salvation with no religious faith to sustain him.

Credits: Producer, Edgar Roulleau ; director, Pierre Granier-Deferre ; writers, Pierre Granier-Deferre, R. M. Arland ; photography, Rene Bucaille ; music, Claude Bolling.
Cast: Maurice Biraud, Christiane Minazzoli, Mona Dol, Genevieve Fontanel, Julien Carette.
